poem:
Title: The Folly of War

The lion of Hamas roars at walls,
while the eagle of Israel withdraws claws,
Bounded by borders, barriers, calls -
Peace shivers in the halls of Cairo's pause.
From Qatar to the States, they attend,
yet progress folds under the weight of pretend.
Words fall like bombs, war without end,
in mankind's long chapter, an unedited amend.
